alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Isle of Wight, and southeastern York Counties, the City of Poquoson, the City of Hampton and the City of Newport News through 815 PM EDT... At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms centered over Northampton, or near Christopher Newport University, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 40 mph and rainfall of 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Localized flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Hampton, Smithfield, Hampton University, Langley AFB, Christopher Newport University, Patrick Henry Field, Seaford, Northampton, Rescue, Buckroe Beach, Denbigh, Tabb, Fort Monroe, Beaconsdale, Fort Eustis, Carrollton, Oriana, Hilton Village and Newport News Golf Course. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; York
